title: How to Arrange Towels on a Towel Bar

steps.title: Spread the towel out over any flat surface.
steps.content: Spread the towel out over any flat surface. You can use a table, the bed, a counter, or whatever is convenient. Fluff the towel out and smooth it down by hand. Turn the towel so the shorter side is closest to you. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the towel into thirds, vertically.
steps.content: Fold the towel into thirds, vertically. Fold the long left edge of the towel into the middle of the towel. Then, fold the opposite third of the towel over the first third. Keep the tag tucked inside if you have guests coming over! [2] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the towel in half and hang it over the bar.
steps.content: Fold the towel in half and hang it over the bar. Fold the two sides with the exposed seams on the back of the towel on top of one another. Then, set the towel over the towel bar. Adjust the hanging ends so they’re both even. [3] X Research source If you’re hanging more than one decorative towel over the same bar, you can space them out a bit for a more practical setup, or line the towels up to touch for a fancier feeling.

steps.title: Place a hand towel on top of the bath towel for an added touch.
steps.content: Place a hand towel on top of the bath towel for an added touch. To hang the hand towel, lay it on a flat surface and fold it into thirds vertically. Once it’s folded, drape it over the large towel on the rack. Choose towels that are color-coordinated if possible!

steps.title: Spread out your towel on a flat surface.
steps.content: Spread out your towel on a flat surface. Turn it so that the long side of the towel is facing you. [4] X Research source The pocket fold is popular in hotels and luxury spas. The neat thing with the pocket fold is that you can put flowers, ribbons, or a small washcloth inside of the little pocket you create.

steps.title: Fold in the short left edge of the towel.
steps.content: Fold in the short left edge of the towel. Bring the short left edge 1/4 of the way in toward the middle. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Flip the towel over.
steps.content: Flip the towel over. Grab the entire towel and flip it upside down without ruining the fold you've made. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the towel into thirds lengthwise.
steps.content: Fold the towel into thirds lengthwise. Fold the bottom long edge of the towel up to the middle. Then, fold the top long edge the same way so that the two layers overlap on top of one another. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the two flaps together loosely to secure the pocket and hang it up.
steps.content: Fold the two flaps together loosely to secure the pocket and hang it up. See the ¼ fold of fabric from the first step? Grab the loose corner. Then, reach underneath the top layer of the towel and grab the other loose corner. Fold the two pieces together to secure the backside of the towel. Place the towel over the towel bar. [8] X Research source This will keep your pocket from coming loose when it’s hanging up on the bar.

steps.title: Fold a washcloth with an accordion pleat and put it in the pocket (optional).
steps.content: Fold a washcloth with an accordion pleat and put it in the pocket (optional). Lay the washcloth flat on a table and fold the sides lengthwise repeatedly to create pleats that overlap one another. Hold the washcloth tight in the center so it doesn’t come undone. Slide the small washcloth inside of the pocket you created on the hand towel. Fan out the washcloth to make it look like a ruffle in the pocket. [9] X Research source Instead of placing a washcloth inside of the pocket, you could alternatively add some fake flowers, a ribbon, or a normally-folded washcloth.

steps.title: Place the towel on a flat surface.
steps.content: Place the towel on a flat surface. Smooth out the towel so it's wrinkle-free. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the towel into thirds and then place it over the bar.
steps.content: Fold the towel into thirds and then place it over the bar. Fold in the two longer edges so they touch in the middle. Then fold the towel in half and drape it over a towel bar. Straighten out the corners so the opposite sides are touching. [11] X Research source This is a super unique look that’s going to impress guests when they see your towels.

steps.title: Fold a small washcloth into a triangle.
steps.content: Fold a small washcloth into a triangle. You can use a washcloth that’s the same color as the towel for a more uniform look or mix it up for something different. Spread the washcloth flat and then fold it into a triangle by overlapping two opposite-side corners. [12] X Research source For a more modern vibe, you can wrap the washcloth around both layers of the towel.

steps.title: Tie the bandana around the towel.
steps.content: Tie the bandana around the towel. Carefully tie the corners of the washcloth around the front-facing flap of the bath towel. If the washcloth is very thick, use a large safety pin or clothes pin to hold it in place. [13] X Research source Get creative and add some silk flowers or other crafty items you might have around to the pocket created by the bandana tie.

steps.title: Start with the towel on a flat surface.
steps.content: Start with the towel on a flat surface. Spread the towel out flat with your hand with the longest side facing you. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the towel in half lengthwise.
steps.content: Fold the towel in half lengthwise. Grab the bottom corners and fold them up to the top corners. Do not press down on the seam you’ve just folded. [15] X Research source The goal of this fold is to keep your towel as fluffy as possible. It’s not quite the best option if you’re looking for a beautiful towel fold for some guests, though.

steps.title: Fold the towel in half again, but widthwise.
steps.content: Fold the towel in half again, but widthwise. Fold it in half in the middle. Adjust the corners so that all of them overlap on top of one another. Again, don’t push down on the fold. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat the widthwise fold and set it over the towel bar.
steps.content: Repeat the widthwise fold and set it over the towel bar. Fold the corners on top of one another again so that you have a thin, bulky towel with none of the creases pushed down. Slide the towel gently over the towel bar. [17] X Research source The next time you hop out of the shower and grab a towel, it’ll be as fluffy as it would be when it just got out of the dryer!
